channel.title: General Portal 2 Thread/Thoughts [Spoilers]
channel.description:
There's so many threads about people interpreting parts of Portal 2, yet there doesn't appear to be any threads about what people thought of the game. [align=center][COLOR='Red']SPOILER ALERT[/SIZE][/align]
If don't want to bother reading my experiances playing the game, skip to the red TL;DR.
I thought the game was very well made. At the beginning I wasn't very impressed and could sort of predict how everything was ending up. But when you first face GLADoS after disabling her turrets and neurotoxin. I was thinking that after Wheatly gained control, GLADoS would find a way of gaining partial control of the facility and you would find yourself in the middle of a way being waged between Wheatly and GLADoS. Yet when Wheatly betrays you, it didn't come as a surprise, but more as a realization and a "I see what you did there Valve" moment.
What I loved about the game the most is how it takes you through the old testing chambers of Apeture Science. These all help you gain an understanding of the history of Apeture as well, it's relations to Black Mesa, and how it became what it is today (Before GLADoS's take over). On a side note it makes me hope Episode 3 adds on to this story and how it looked from Black Mesa's point of view.
The final test chambers and Boss battle with Wheatly are my honest to god favorite parts of the game. I enjoy the test chambers mostly because of how you can visually see Apeture falling apart into flames and to hear GLADoS's reactions to it.
The final battle with Wheatly, though, was a bit easier than I would have liked/ Admittedly, though, it took me a while to figure out what to do and got the last personality sphere on with less than 10 seconds left, so that made it a challenge enough for me at the time. But the moon thing kinda blew me away when it happened. Mostly because it was almost 3 am, I just wanted to finally finish Portal 2, when I was on the ground, unable to move, I had no idea what to do. In fact, I kept shooting the portal gun at Wheatly in hopes that it would do something. Finally, I just shot at the moon because I couldn't think of anything else to shoot at. I literally shat bricks when I saw a twinkle on the moon, suddenly found everything being sucked into the portal on earth. The Apollo stuff was also pretty cool, really liked that. And the ending was really nice, especially with the Companion Cube being shot out. And the thing at the very end with Wheatly and the Space personality sphere made me laugh so loud.
[COLOR='Red']TL;DR My overall impressions: Pros: Continued the funny, dark humor that was in Portal 1 to an even greater level. Looks a lot more nicer than original. Story didn't suck Cons: Basically made markings showing you where portals had to be made. Also I felt like you were more limited by where you could put portals, and that in some spots it would automatically put it in a certain way. Took away some of the challenge.
Well there's my two cents. Feel free to criticize and tell yours too.

item.title: General Portal 2 Thread/Thoughts [Spoilers]
item.dc:creator: austin23cook
item.description:
mankyman6:

Of course Cave and Caroline didn’t make Chell, they adopted her…

GLaDOS clearly states that Chell is adopted, multiple times, and she even seriously states the fact after a conversation with Wheatley. Yes, she does lie, but I think she’s telling the truth on that one.

to further support this, one of the early released spoilers contained an “email” about different types of test subjects and how to “motivate them” it went over how psychos dont do the test the just tend to whipe feces on things and cant really be motivated, the homeless would do anything for money. and that orphans should be constantly berated about not having parents, and then as an after thought CJ asks why he doesnt pull his funding from aperture mental institutions and fund more aperture orphanages.

Read full topic

item.title: General Portal 2 Thread/Thoughts [Spoilers]
item.dc:creator: Eipa
item.description:
Krazor:

Did anyone see Wheatley going rogue coming? I had no idea!

I did. When he was like press the button!! I though to myself “this guy is going to betray me…” And to my surprise I was right… I mean, I would’ve done the same thing. Power corrupts.

item.description:
DrasarSalman:

So, you could theoretically make a portal gel out of normal cheese? Which is much cheaper and doesn’t kill Cave? Did aperture transport something from the moon which you just could buy from the local grocery store? What were the scientists thinking!?

they hint at inefficient production all over aperture science

item.description:
Medevilae:

It’s full of misinformed/false information anyway, according to some Valve employees.

So those morons employees have only them self to blame as to what info they gave him, and you are and idiot for believing that. You dont give an interview to someone, and later call them misinformed with the info you gave them yourself O_o
I got the final hourns in a PDF file, you can find it on the webz.

Pettifogg:

It was great! Can’t wait for the SDK.

Incidentally, fun fact: moon rocks are actually black.

LOLOLOL, haha, never knew that, i always thought they were gray ;f

item.title: General Portal 2 Thread/Thoughts [Spoilers]
item.dc:creator: RestlessMind
item.description:
You guys obviously have never seen a Brazilian person. They’re pretty much white / look like super tanned white people. I used to know one that was whiter than me, anyways, and I’m super whitey.

Anyways, I finished Portal 2 earlier today (long before I dared go near anyone who had already finished it) and I liked it alright. I think the giant turret animal king was kind of obnoxious and pushing it, but other than that, I loved it. ESPECIALLY when you get the (albeit scorched) Companion Cube back.

Read full topic

item.title: General Portal 2 Thread/Thoughts [Spoilers]
item.dc:creator: DiePoente
item.description:
They always do, without a exception. Recently, I’ve read that Telltale games have delayed the Jurassic Park adventure game. They even give a compensation. Those who preordered it get a free Telltale game of your choice. And what do the people? They bitch around, that they can’t play it this month.

The length of P2 was absolutely perfect, imo. Not too long, not too short. It was way longer than P1, as Valve said so. I’ve been completely entertained.

Read full topic

Glad I just rented it tbh.

item.title: General Portal 2 Thread/Thoughts [Spoilers]
item.dc:creator: Grandmaster_Ramrod
item.description:
I know I don’t post here much (read: at all), but this bugged me enough to get other opinions on the matter.

I just played through Portal 2 and loved it. The game was well put together, gameplay was smooth and felt natural with some puzzles that had me thinking. The moon bit was pretty cool too.

Alas, my game was ruined by these bloody loading screens after each chamber, not to mention the cutscene at the end? I love the Half-Life series probably more than any other title, reason being the whole, “play from the character’s point of view” thing Valve’s got going on. It just kinda pissed me off. S’all.

Read full topic
